section.title: What the network objects are?
section.para: Network objects are an easy way to give a name to a network item, or a group of them. They are used to simplify network configuration management, allowing you to choose different behaviours for each item or group of them with just a descriptive name.

Network objects can be used, for instance, to five a name to an IP or a group of IPs. If the object is a group of IPs, instead of defining some rules for each IP, every IP inside the object will acquire that configuration.

section.title: Network objects management
section.para: Network objects used by eBox can be created, modified and erased in an easy and intuitive way using the web interface.

section.title: Object creation
section.para: New object creation is done at Objects .
So, you should enter the name's object at the text input and click Create .
The next step is to enter every member for the object shown in the screen. For each member, you can define:

listitem.para: Name : name assigned to the member.
Network mask : netowkr mask, using CIDR notation
MAC (optional): hardware adress -or MAC adress- of the network interface corresponding to that IP adress.

section.para: Once you hace entered those fields, click at its Action add icon.

section.title: Edit objects
section.para: To edit one object, just click at its Action edit icon. Edition process is identical as creation one.

section.title: Objects removal
section.para: To remove one object located at the current object list, you have to click at its Action removal icon.
